candidates.title: Why Chinas Didi can succeed where Uber has struggled
candidates.content:
To glimpse the future of the ride-hailing business, look east
Feb 20th 2021|beijing
Editors note (June 30th 2021): Shares in Didi are due to start trading on the New York Stock Exchange today. Its initial public offering is expected to give the firm a market capitalisation of more than $67bn. This piece from February explains the importance of Chinas ride-hailing market and Didis place in it.
This article appeared in the Business section of the print edition under the headline Trafficking dreams
From the February 20th 2021 edition
